sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: The adoption and development of a community comanagement approach to conservation in Liangheyuan Nature Reserve demonstrates improved management effectiveness for a wetland PA in the Altai Mountains and Wetland Landscape
Reduction in biodiversity pressure from mining

comment.narrative: 6800 ha of PA land in NR is still threatened by mining activities
Illegal gold mining activities stopped in NR and restoration of 800 ha of land previously degraded by mining
Totally stopped the illegal mining activities in Liangheyuan NR And covered 300 ha of previous degraded land planted blackcurrant in some part of the restoration area
Illegal gold mining activities stopped in NR and restoration of 800 ha of land previously degraded by mining
Totally stopped the illegal mining activities in Liangheyuan NR And covered 300 ha of previous degraded land planted blackcurrant in some part of the restoration area

description.narrative: Reduction in biodiversity pressure from overgrazing

comment.narrative:
7000 herding families graze livestock in the NR in summer incl 170 families approx 40000 stock in ecologically sensitive Sandaohaizi wetland
Management zones in Liangheyuan NR not rationalized

Livestock numbers reduced by 20 in Sandaohaizi wetland with economic burden to local people offset with alternative complementary livelihoods
Zoning of Liangheyuan NR reassessed and modified based on EHI surveys with illegal mining banned in corebuffer zones and grazing banned in core zones

Some of the herder families from Sandaohaizi are trying to change from herding to business livestock numbers reduced a little no statistic data yet The core zone of Liangheyuan NR is under strict management no human activities In addition of local herders the activities in buffer zone is reducing

Livestock numbers reduced by 20 in Sandaohaizi wetland with economic burden to local people offset with alternative complementary livelihoods
Zoning of Liangheyuan NR reassessed and modified based on EHI surveys with illegal mining banned in corebuffer zones and grazing banned in core zones

Some of the herder families from Sandaohaizi are trying to change from herding to business livestock numbers reduced a little no statistic data yet The core zone of Liangheyuan NR is under strict management no human activities In addition of local herders the activities in buffer zone is reducing

description.narrative: Enhanced socioeconomic options to compensate for lost opportunities improving local economic situation

comment.narrative:
Community ecotourism not present in project area Liangheyuan NR
Avg household income is 1980 CNYyear in Sandaohaizi community

At least 3 community tourism ventures established bringing benefit to at least 30 families serving as a model for upscaling
Average household income for park residents increased by at least 20 as a result of new livelihood opportunities

Supported tourism cooperative which established by 10 herder families of Sandaohaizi increased income through ecotourism Also organized training courses of handicrafts and cooking in Sandaohaizi area trying to enhance socioeconomic options

At least 3 community tourism ventures established bringing benefit to at least 30 families serving as a model for upscaling
Average household income for park residents increased by at least 20 as a result of new livelihood opportunities

Supported tourism cooperative which established by 10 herder families of Sandaohaizi increased income through ecotourism Also organized training courses of handicrafts and cooking in Sandaohaizi area trying to enhance socioeconomic options

description.narrative: Populations of threatened species beavers moose wolverine are stable

comment.narrative:
Wildlife populations
Beaver 300400
Moose tbd
Wolverine tbd
All select wildlife populations are stable or increasing

Through visit the local families and monitoring known the population of threatened species are increasing can notice ibex red deer regularly and spotted the brown bear wolve and sable by infrared camera

description.narrative: The biodiversity of the Altai Mountains and Wetland Landscape is effectively conserved with a strengthened PA network and enhanced operational budget through adoption of a landscape level approach to conservation planning and environmental management
Improved ecological conditions of PAs as per Ecosysteml Health Index EHI

comment.narrative:
EHI scores
Liangheyuan NR 67
Kekesu Wetland NR 67
Buergen Beaver NR 57

EHI Scores
Liangheyuan NR gt 75
Kekesu Wetland NR gt 75
Buergen Beaver NR gt 70
Organized EHI training in every NR while CTA was on his first mission No data collection yet cause its a preliminary arranged activity

description.narrative: Reduction in incidence of new mining contracts in PAs in AMWL region

comment.narrative: Gold mining still occurs in some PAs despite current regulations but no specific baseline figures available
No mining occurs inside PAs in AMWL region
The human activities in NR of Altay region has been control effectively no outside people in NR except the herders and management staffs No new mining contract signed
No mining occurs inside PAs in AMWL region
The human activities in NR of Altay region has been control effectively no outside people in NR except the herders and management staffs No new mining contract signed

description.narrative: Viable alternative options are developed for herding communities that offset economic dependency on grazing inside PAs

comment.narrative: No assistance available from PA system to help local communities with economic opportunities
New comanagement structures are in place which support and strengthen alternative livelihood options for Kazakh herders and other forms of collaboration

Trying on developing of alternative plan for herding communities Supported tourism cooperative of Sandaohaizi increase income through ecotourism Organized 4 phase handicrafts training in Chagan township which helped herders increase income

description.narrative: Cooperation between AltaiSayan Ecoregion countries is enhanced

comment.narrative:
No conservation action plan for Chinese beaver
No relationship between two adjacent NRs in Altai Mtns

Beaver conservation action plan developed and adopted agreed by Altai Prefecture and the local government in Mongolia
Tavan Bogd NP Liangheyuan NR partnership MOU is reached
Established cooperation relationship with Tavan Bogd NP of Mongolia had communications and visits for two times and Memorandum of Cooperation was signed

Beaver conservation action plan developed and adopted agreed by Altai Prefecture and the local government in Mongolia
Tavan Bogd NP Liangheyuan NR partnership MOU is reached
Established cooperation relationship with Tavan Bogd NP of Mongolia had communications and visits for two times and Memorandum of Cooperation was signed

description.narrative: Operational budgets for PAs in AMWL increase

comment.narrative: Operational budget for AMWL PA network is US 1515594 per year
Operational budget is increased by 40 with new contributions from local prefecture and provincial government
Operational budget for AMWL PA network has not been calculated yet
Operational budget is increased by 40 with new contributions from local prefecture and provincial government
Operational budget for AMWL PA network has not been calculated yet

description.narrative: The protection of wetland ecosystems through PA planning and management is enhanced in Altai Prefecture and XUAR through systemic legal and institutional capacity strengthening

Improved capacity scorecard SC scores of Forestry Department for participatory approaches in PA planning and management Q8 in SC PA staff competencies Q9 1619 in SC and public awareness and support Q21 in SC

comment.narrative:
Average score for Q89 1619 and 21 is 143
Most PA management plans not designed in participatory ways and not comprehensive and most PAs not managed collaboratively
Many Forestry and PA staff with inadequate skills for their jobs
Systematic monitoring and reporting systems not established limited availability or access to information necessary for PA operations incl biodiversity and socioeconomic development situations innear PAs

Average score for Q89 1619 and 21 is 24 at minimum through inter alia the following improvements
Majority of PAs in AMWL with updated and participatorially prepared management plans including comanagement components
More systematic staff training program designed and initiated
Accessible data and information sharing platform developed under supervision of XFD in support of PA management operationalised
Data sharing platform includes freeform categories for observations or information incl complaints submitted anonymously or by the public
This work expected to be done in 2016

Average score for Q89 1619 and 21 is 24 at minimum through inter alia the following improvements
Majority of PAs in AMWL with updated and participatorially prepared management plans including comanagement components
More systematic staff training program designed and initiated
Accessible data and information sharing platform developed under supervision of XFD in support of PA management operationalised
Data sharing platform includes freeform categories for observations or information incl complaints submitted anonymously or by the public
This work expected to be done in 2016

description.narrative: Existence of operational safeguard measures to protect wetland habitat and biodiversity from infrastructure placement and mining

comment.narrative:
EIA procedures are not adequately followed leading to undesirable impacts from infrastructure construction and mining
No legal obligation for postmining rehabilitation
No system for reporting malfeasance or through which to submit formal concerns or complaints or to make suggestions

EIA law is strictly enforced for construction and mining projects affecting wetland PAs with full participation of the wetland and PA management authorities
Clear standards are officially set up and enforced with minimum requirements for postextraction site restoration of mining sites
Hotline contact number operationalized also see the information platform above with referral system ie to other sectors in place

EIA laws enforced for construction and mining projects affecting wetland PAs ecosystem experts have chances to participate and provide suggestions on relevant sectors project which influence wetland habitat and biodiversity

EIA law is strictly enforced for construction and mining projects affecting wetland PAs with full participation of the wetland and PA management authorities
Clear standards are officially set up and enforced with minimum requirements for postextraction site restoration of mining sites
Hotline contact number operationalized also see the information platform above with referral system ie to other sectors in place

EIA laws enforced for construction and mining projects affecting wetland PAs ecosystem experts have chances to participate and provide suggestions on relevant sectors project which influence wetland habitat and biodiversity

description.narrative: Existence of effective legal framework for the Xinjiang PA system emplaced enhancing the conservation status of natural wetlands within the 35 PAs in Xinjiang UAR

comment.narrative:
No provincial level PA regulations w guidance for managers or clear stipulation of levels of authority
No sector plans that integrate PA objectives as well as biodiversity

Provincial regulations for PAs proposed by the XFD including wetland considerations greater clarity of different management categories and new framework for comanaged PA zones
At least two sectoral plans integrate PA objectives and biodiversity considerations such as water resources and agricultural bureaus
Regulation of Wetland Conservationhas been issued Carried out researches for 2 times in last year and provided primary suggestions on revising of PA Regulations

Provincial regulations for PAs proposed by the XFD including wetland considerations greater clarity of different management categories and new framework for comanaged PA zones
At least two sectoral plans integrate PA objectives and biodiversity considerations such as water resources and agricultural bureaus
Regulation of Wetland Conservationhas been issued Carried out researches for 2 times in last year and provided primary suggestions on revising of PA Regulations

description.narrative: To strengthen the management effectiveness of PAs to respond to existing and emerging threats to the globally significant biodiversity and essential ecosystem services in the Altai Mountains and Wetland Landscapes in Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region

Component Legal regulatory and institutional frameworks
Component 2 Business planning and tools for costeffective management
Component 3 Tools for revenue generation

description.narrative: Increase in PA coverage strengthened resilience and connectivity in the AMWL

comment.narrative: PA network design not optimized for resilience and connectivity

Incorporation of AMNFPPA into AMWL PA framework
Expansion of PA system in AMWL with total increase of at least 150000 ha in coverage
Regional collaboration with neighbouring PAs enhanced
2 wetland parks were established and the wetland protected area increased further by 438952 ha in 2014 which had achieved 29 of the total target
